notes.text:
Netscape Navigator and Netscape Communicator 4.8 as distributed with Red
Hat Enterprise Linux 2.1 contain security flaws and should not be used.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Netscape Navigator and Netscape Communicator have been removed from the Red
Hat Enterprise Linux 2.1 CD-ROM distribution as part of Update 5. These
packages were based on Netscape 4.8, which is known to be vulnerable to
recent critical security issues, such as CAN-2004-0597, CAN-2004-0598, and
CAN-2004-0599. 

Netscape 7.2 contains fixes for these issues and is available from
http://www.netscape.com/.  Netscape 4.8 packages will also remain available
via Red Hat Network for those who choose to use them despite their known
security vulnerabilities.
                               
Users of Netscape 4.8 are advised to switch to Mozilla, which is included
and supported in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 2.1, and offers comparable
functionality.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Netscape security update

notes.text: Multiple buffer overflows in libpng 1.2.5 and earlier, as used in multiple products, allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via malformed PNG images in which (1) the png_handle_tRNS function does not properly validate the length of transparency chunk (tRNS) data, or the (2) png_handle_sBIT or (3) png_handle_hIST functions do not perform sufficient bounds checking.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

remediations.details:
Red Hat Enterprise 2.1 users who do not need the functionality of Netscape 
4.8 should uninstall the netscape packages.

notes.text: The png_handle_iCCP function in libpng 1.2.5 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a certain PNG image that triggers a null dereference.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

remediations.details:
Red Hat Enterprise 2.1 users who do not need the functionality of Netscape 
4.8 should uninstall the netscape packages.

notes.text: Multiple integer overflows in the (1) png_read_png in pngread.c or (2) png_handle_sPLT functions in pngrutil.c or (3) progressive display image reading capability in libpng 1.2.5 and earlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a malformed PNG image.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

remediations.details:
Red Hat Enterprise 2.1 users who do not need the functionality of Netscape 
4.8 should uninstall the netscape packages.
